description: view up from a slightly low vantage point; figure kneeling on stairs at right before a king with a long beard and wearing a crown seated on a throne; other figures standing at right, one figure standing at left; architectural details in background, URQ
medium: Pen and gray-brown ink and wash on laid paper
provenance: Sale, Sotheby's, London, July 4, 1994, part of no.129, as 17th-century Flemish school, for Â£750, to Moir; Alfred Moir, Santa Barbara (1994-d. 2010; bequeathed to MIA)
title: Panthea before Cyrus the Great, King of Persia
